headline: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Is Surging After Joining the S&P 500. Can It Continue to Skyrocket?
summary: Datadog stock has gone parabolic in the past three months, and it recently shot up following the news of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index.  Datadog's lucrative addressable opportunity suggests that it may be able to justify its valuation in the long run.  Shares of Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) shot up nearly 15% on July 3 after it was revealed that the provider of cloud-based observability, monitoring, and security solutions will join the S&P 500 index on July 9.

headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Tesla, Amazon, Moderna, Fair Isaac, Exxon, Sunrun, SoFi, Datadog, and More
summary: Stocks were mixed on Tuesday after President Donald Trump said he wouldn’t delay the date when his tariffs will take effect.  CEO Elon Musk announced over the weekend that he would form a new political party, and his return to politics prompted investors to sell the stock.  Musk strongly opposed Trump’s tax-and-spending bill that was signed into law Friday.

headline: Boeing, Robinhood & EU, Datadog downgrade: Trending Tickers
summary: Boeing's (BA) second quarter jet deliveries marked the company's highest quarterly deliveries number since 2023. Robinhood's (HOOD) new tokenized US stocks and private company stakes face scrutiny in the European Union under Lithuania's banking regulations. Check out Yahoo Finance's interview with Robinhood CEO and chairman, Vlad Tenev, here. Datadog (DDOG) was downgraded by Guggenheim analysts to Sell from Neutral, citing concerns about the impact of OpenAI's (OPAI.PVT) shift away from the company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Datadog Fell Today
summary: Datadog was downgraded to "sell" by a sell-side analyst firm today.  This threat to Datadog has wider implications for the broader enterprise software world.  Shares of Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) fell on Tuesday, down as much as 6.3%, before recovering slightly to a 4.1% decline as of 12:51 p.m. ET.

headline: Why Datadog (DDOG) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of cloud monitoring software company Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) fell 4.2% in the afternoon session after Guggenheim downgraded the stock to Sell from Neutral, citing risks related to its largest customer, OpenAI.

headline: Boeing jet deliveries, Circle & Datadog Sell ratings
summary: Julie Hyman takes a closer look at what's driving US stock moves on Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Boeing (BA) reports strong delivery numbers, a positive signal for the plane maker. Circle (CRCL) gets a Sell rating from Mizuho analysts just a month after the company went public. Datadog (DDOG) was downgraded by Guggenheim analysts to Sell from Neutral, citing risks associated with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Amazon, Exxon, Sunrun, Enphase, SoFi, Datadog, and More
summary: Stocks traded mostly to the downside Tuesday after President Donald Trump extended the date when his so-called reciprocal tariffs would take effect to Aug. 1 from July 9.  Equities tumbled Monday following Trump’s posting of letters to 14 global trading partners, including Japan and South Korea, outlining tariff rates they would pay if they didn’t strike trade deals.  Tesla   was up 1.1% after the stock fell 6.8% on Monday.

Tesla   was up 1.1% after the stock fell 6.8% on Monday.

headline: Datadog Stock Falls on Downgrade to Sell. Analysts Fret Over OpenAI Optimization Risk.
summary: Datadog  stock was downgraded at Guggenheim Securities with analysts sounding the alarm about the potential withdrawal of one of its artificial intelligence-native customers and the resulting hit on revenue.  Datadog’s  name has been in the news due to its forthcoming addition to the  index.  Shares surged last Wednesday after S&P Dow Jones Indices said Datadog would replace Juniper Networks on July 9, following Juniper’s acquisition by  Hewlett Packard Enterprise  Despite Tuesday’s losses, the stock remains higher since the close on July 2, before the changes were announced.

Datadog’s  name has been in the news due to its forthcoming addition to the  index.  Shares surged last Wednesday after S&P Dow Jones Indices said Datadog would replace Juniper Networks on July 9, following Juniper’s acquisition by  Hewlett Packard Enterprise  Despite Tuesday’s losses, the stock remains higher since the close on July 2, before the changes were announced.

headline: Guggenheim downgrades Datadog on fears that OpenAI will cut spending
summary: Investing.com -- Guggenheim cut Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) rating to Sell from Neutral on a target price of $105, warning the software company could suffer a sharp revenue hit if OpenAI, which is its biggest customer, moves workloads in‑house.
